block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
FILM
Springfield ''An Inconvenient Truth,'' documentary with Al Gore. Tuesday at noon. Free. Donald B. Palmer Museum, 66 Mountain Avenue. (973) 376-4930.
FOR CHILDREN

Morristown The Dirty Sock Funtime Band, family concert. April 22 at 1:30 and 4 p.m. $12. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. Princeton ''The Adventures of Perseus,'' puppet show written and directed by Christopher T. Parks. Ages 5 and up. April 29 at 11 a.m. $12. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. South Orange ''Cashore Marionettes: Simple Gifts,'' with the music of Vivaldi, Beethoven, Strauss and Copland. April 29 at 1 and 4 p.m. South Orange Performing Arts Center, 1 Sopac Way. (973) 313-2787.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Camden Philip Glass, composer and pianist; a reception and question-and-answer session precede the concert at 6 p.m. April 29 at 8 p.m. $26 and $30. Gordon Theater, Rutgers University-Camden Campus, Third and Pearl Streets. (856) 225-2700. Cape May Annual Cape May Jazz Festival, ''A Tribute to Wes Montgomery,'' with workshops and performances. Through April 22. $25 to $190; workshops, free. Cape May Convention Hall, 720 Beach Drive at Stockton Avenue. (609) 884-5404. Englewood Michael Franks and The Rippingtons, jazz. April 22 at 7 p.m. $28 to $85. George Benson, jazz guitarist and singer. Friday at 8 p.m. $30 to $100. ''New Jersey Ballet's All-American Evening,'' including Agnes de Mille's ''Rodeo.'' April 28 at 8 p.m. $20 to $40. ''Sleeping Beauty,'' by the New Jersey Ballet. April 29 at 1 and 4:30 p.m. $20 to $35. Bergen Performing Arts Center, 30 North Van Brunt Street. (201) 227-1030. Morristown George Benson, jazz guitarist and singer. Thursday at 8 p.m. $60 to $75. The New Philharmonic of New Jersey. April 28 at 8 p.m. $25 to $45. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. New Brunswick Maurice Hines, tap dancer and choreographer. Thursday through April 29. $40 to $45. Crossroads Theater, 7 Livingston Avenue. (732) 545-8100. New Brunswick ''Falsettos,'' musical by William Finn and James Lapine. Through May 6. $28 to $64. George Street Playhouse, 9 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7717. New Brunswick Stephen Lynch, musician, actor and comedian. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $29.50 to $35. The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra. Thursday at 8 p.m. $22 to $77. Gilbert and Sullivan's ''H.M.S. Pinafore,'' presented by the New York Gilbert and Sullivan Players. Friday at 8 p.m. $25 to $55. Michael Amante, tenor, with Debby Boone; benefit for the Cerebral Palsy Association of Middlesex County. April 28 at 8 p.m. $20 to $125. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. Newark John Legend, with Corinne Bailey Rae, rhythm and blues. April 22 at 7:30 p.m. Sold out. Patrizio Buanne, singer. Monday at 7:30 p.m. $30 to $52. Salsa Dance Party with Hermán Olivera. Friday at 8 p.m. $32. The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra. Friday through April 29. $20 to $78. Nicholas Payton, trumpeter, and Kenny Garrett, saxophonist; jazz. April 28 at 7:30 p.m. $44 to $54. Los Angeles Philharmonic. April 28 at 8 p.m. $24 to $88. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. Princeton ''Connect Transfer,'' multimedia dance choreographed by Shen Wei. Tuesday at 8 p.m. $37 to $44. Medeski, Martin and Wood, folk. Friday at 8 p.m. $15 to $40. Chris Botti, jazz trumpeter, $50. April 28 at 8 p.m. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Princeton Princeton Pro Musica; works by Rachmaninoff, Schnittke and Bartok; a lecture precedes the concert at 3 p.m. April 29 at 4 p.m. $38 and $45. Richardson Auditorium, Princeton University, Nassau Street. (609) 497-0020. Red Bank Gordon Lightfoot, folk. April 22 at 7 p.m. $38 to $88. ''The Wizard of Oz,'' ballet by the Company of Dance Arts; the April 28 performance will be followed by ''Off to Oz!'' with characters, photos and arts and crafts: $10. April 28 and 29. $12 to $30. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000. South Orange Tommy Dorsey Orchestra, big band. April 28 at 7 p.m. $45. South Orange Performing Arts Center, 1 Sopac Way. (973) 313-2787. Trenton Verdi's ''Rigoletto,'' presented by the Boheme Opera; in Italian with supertitles. Through April 22. $27 to $67. Patriots Theater at the War Memorial, Memorial Drive. (609) 984-8400. Watchung The Sanctuary Concerts Sunday Night Music Club: Dan Friedman, folk. April 22 at 7 p.m. $15. Watchung Arts Center, 18 Stirling Road. (908) 753-0190.
THEATER

Atlantic Highlands ''Miss Witherspoon,'' comedy by Christopher Durang. Through April 28. $15 to $20. First Avenue Playhouse, 123 First Avenue. (732) 291-7552. Cranford ''Open Admissions,'' drama by Shirley Lauro, presented by the Theater Project. Through April 28. $10 to $20. Union County College, 1033 Springfield Avenue. (908) 659-5189. Eatontown ''The Lion in Winter,'' drama by James Goldman, presented by Over the Rainbow. Through April 28. $17 to $22. Eatontown Playhouse, Tower Market Shopping Center, 37-13 Route 35 North. (732) 460-0100. Long Branch ''Love and Murder,'' drama by Arthur Giron. Through May 6. $25 to $40. New Jersey Repertory Company, 179 Broadway. (732) 229-3166. Millburn ''Seven Brides for Seven Brothers,'' musical by Lawrence Kasha, David Landay, Johnny Mercer and Gene de Paul, adapted from the musical film directed by Stanley Donen. Through May 13. $23.25 to $72.25. Paper Mill Playhouse, 3 Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. New Brunswick ''In the Sawtooths,'' drama by Dano Madden, presented by the Rutgers Theater Company. Through April 28. $15 to $25. ''Derby Day,'' premiere of the dark comedy by Samuel Brett Williams, presented by the Rutgers Theater Company. Through April 29. $15 to $25. Mason Gross Performing Arts Center, Douglass Campus, Rutgers University, 85 George Street. (732) 932-7511. New Brunswick Chinese Golden Dragon Acrobats. April 22 at 2 and 5 p.m. $20 to $50. ''The Canterbury Tales,'' presented by Aquila Theater Company. April 29 at 3 p.m. $20 to $35. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. Nutley ''I Hate Hamlet,'' comedy by Paul Rudnick. Through April 28. $12. Nutley Little Theater, 47 Erie Place (off Brookfield Avenue). (973) 667-0374. Pomona ''The Canterbury Tales,'' presented by the Aquila Theater Company. Friday at 8 p.m. $25 and $40. Stockton Performing Arts Center, Richard Stockton College, Jim Leeds Road. (609) 652-9000. South Orange ''Dead Man Walking,'' drama by Tim Robbins, adapted from the book by Sister Helen Prejean. Through April 22. $8 to $15. South Orange Performing Arts Center, 1 Sopac Way. (973) 313-2787. Sussex Shakespeare's ''Twelfth Night,'' presented by the Tri-State Actors Theater. Through May 6. $17 to $27. Crescent Theater, 74 Main Street. (973) 875-2950. Wayne ''Quilters,'' musical by Molly Newman and Barbara Damashek. Through April 22. $8 and $10. Hunziker Theatre, William Paterson University, 300 Pompton Road. (973) 720-2371. Wayne ''Seussical,'' musical by Stephen Flaherty and Lynn Ahrens, adapted from the books by Dr. Seuss; presented by theWilliam Paterson University Pioneer Players. Through April 22. $3 to $7. YM-YWHA of North Jersey, 1 Pike Drive. (973) 595-0100. West Windsor ''Woyzeck,'' drama by Georg Buchner. Through April 29. $10 and $12. ''The Three Pigs,'' musical presented by Kaleidoscope Theater. April 28 at 2 and 4 p.m. $8 and $10. Kelsey Theater, West Windsor Campus, Mercer County Community College, 1200 Old Trenton Road. (609) 570-3333.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Cape May ''Small Towns, Black Lives: African American Communities in New Jersey,'' photography by Wendel A. White. Through May 13. $1 and $2. Mid-Atlantic Center for the Arts, 1048 Washington Street. (609) 884-5404. Clinton ''Barbara Klein: New Marks,'' abstract paintings, and ''How American Women Artists Invented Post Modernism,'' group show presented by the Feminist Art Project. Through June 3. Donation: $3. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hunterdon Museum of Art, 7 Lower Center Street. (908) 735-8415. Hopewell ''Double Take: Two Photographers, Two Coney Islands,'' works by Joanna Tully and Marty Schwartz. Through May 27. Artist talk: April 22, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. Lambertville ''Constructions and Reconstructions,'' mixed media and photography by Nancy Shill and John Treichler. Through April 29. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., or by appointment. Artists' Gallery, 32 Coryell Street. (609) 397-4588. Lincroft Photographs from the collection of Brookdale Community College, including works from prominent 20th-century documentary and fine art photographers. Through April 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth Museum, Brookdale Community College, Newman Springs Road. (732) 747-2266. Maplewood ''Raw Spirits: A Survey of Contemporary Folk and Outsider Art in America,'' group show. Through May 27. 1978 Arts Center, 1978 Springfield Avenue. (973) 275-9855. Maplewood ''Lisa Pressman: Mixed Media, Transitions and Processes.'' Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Thursdays, noon to 8 p.m. Classic Design Framing, 168 Maplewood Avenue. (973) 762-5588. Montclair ''Dreaming of a Speech Without Words: The Painting and Early Objects of H. C. Westermann.'' Through May 27. $6 to $8; free for members and children 12 and under. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Montclair Art Museum, 3 South Mountain Avenue. (973) 746-5555. New Brunswick ''Natvar Bhavsar: The Dimensions of Color,'' paintings. Through July 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Jane Voorhees Zimmerli Art Museum, 71 Hamilton Street. (732) 932-7237. Oceanville ''Spinning Worlds: Emerging Artists,'' works by Paul Santoleri and Carla Falb. ''Surface Rhythms,'' work by Bennett Bean and Barbara Bullock. Both through April 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Noyes Museum of Art, 733 Lily Lake Road. (609) 652-8848. Princeton ''History, Identity or None of the Above: Regarding African American Art,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through May 13. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton University Art Museum, Nassau and Witherspoon Streets. (609) 258-3788. Skillman Group show by the A-Team Artists of Trenton. Through May 6. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Montgomery Center for the Arts, 124 Montgomery Road. (609) 921-3272. South Orange ''Cathexis: Art of Obsession,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 6. ''Poetry at Pierro,'' poetry readings and open mike, April 29, 2 to 4 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Pierro Gallery, 5 Mead Street. (973) 378-7755. Springfield ''Structures,'' photographs by Sue Zwick. Through Thursday. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.; Tuesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 3:30 p.m. Donald B. Palmer Museum, 66 Mountain Avenue. (973) 376-4930. Summit ''Wes Sherman: Recent Works,'' paintings. Through May 19. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Domo Gallery, 447 Springfield Avenue. (908) 608-0079. Trenton Wood-fired ceramics and handmade paper and printmaking, by Peter Callas and Margaret Kennard Johnson. Through April 22. $2 to $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Trenton City Museum, Cadwalader Park. (609) 989-3632. Union ''As I See It,'' photography by Jane H. Rapp. Through June 13. Les Malamut Art Gallery, 1800 Morris Avenue. (908) 851-5450. Upper Montclair ''Narcissus,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Sundays by appointment. Gallery of Modern Symbolism, 594 Valley Road. Washington Township ''In the Shadows of Manhattan,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 22. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Atrium Gallery, Bergen County Y, 605 Pascack Road. (201) 666-6610, Extension 222.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
